motif.title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

linkedContent: from 3 etymological stems of Being: living, emerging, abiding [compare how Heidegger uses etymology to Derrida, dissemination] > different meanings imply experiences > Nothing arises merely through loss [re: not tracing how the different meanings grow together into one verb] [annihilation of trace?]

content: Wesen (essence) originally meant enduring as present (Gegenwart), not quidditas [original meaning hard to distinguish from a meaning of existence]
linkedContent: Wesen (essence) originally meant enduring as present (Gegenwart), not quidditas [original meaning hard to distinguish from a meaning of existence]

content: “what dominant meaning persists through all the blurring of this blending?” > living, emerging, abiding not arbitrary details in sphere of sayable
linkedContent: “what dominant meaning persists through all the blurring of this blending?” > living, emerging, abiding not arbitrary details in sphere of sayable

content: “Being” now just counts as sound of a word (Wortlaut) for us, a used-up term (vernutzter Titel): we must grasp all we have left (verbliebt), this last remnant (letzten Rest) of a possession (Besitz) [trace] > how does it stand w/ the word Being?
linkedContent: “Being” now just counts as sound of a word (Wortlaut) for us, a used-up term (vernutzter Titel): we must grasp all we have left (verbliebt), this last remnant (letzten Rest) of a possession (Besitz) [trace] > how does it stand w/ the word Being?

content: “Being” (re: its meaning), a blending/blurring that levels off 3 different stem meanings: explains why “to be” is empty, its meaning evanescent [but Heidegger has not spoken his final word]
linkedContent: “Being” (re: its meaning), a blending/blurring that levels off 3 different stem meanings: explains why “to be” is empty, its meaning evanescent [but Heidegger has not spoken his final word]

content: Heidegger examining “to be” to put it in the place where it belongs [how does he know it belongs somewhere?]
linkedContent: Heidegger examining “to be” to put it in the place where it belongs [how does he know it belongs somewhere?]

content: “Being” as emptiest thus embraces everything: highest generic concept, genus, ens in genere > to want to attach decisive question of metaphysics to empty word “Being” causes confusion > admit it’s empty, leave it in peace, w/ a good conscience [?]
linkedContent: “Being” as emptiest thus embraces everything: highest generic concept, genus, ens in genere > to want to attach decisive question of metaphysics to empty word “Being” causes confusion > admit it’s empty, leave it in peace, w/ a good conscience [?]

content: [method, “is”] away from empty “Being” to special characteristics of beings themselves: earth, moon, land, sea, Japanese > Heidegger will not be doubting being [?], such considerations, w/ air of supreme critique, are thoroughly uncritical [is that an argument? factical life dogma?] > we must know what “is” and “to be” means since we let let each being be the being that it is [do we? “w/out thinking,” he adds]

motif.name: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]
motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

linkedContent: [method, “is”] away from empty “Being” to special characteristics of beings themselves: earth, moon, land, sea, Japanese > Heidegger will not be doubting being [?], such considerations, w/ air of supreme critique, are thoroughly uncritical [is that an argument? factical life dogma?] > we must know what “is” and “to be” means since we let let each being be the being that it is [do we? “w/out thinking,” he adds]

content: we distinguish Being from not-Being, constantly faced w/ beings > we know unambiguously what “Being” means [facticity?] > now claim of empty/indefinite Being is a superficial way of speaking
linkedContent: we distinguish Being from not-Being, constantly faced w/ beings > we know unambiguously what “Being” means [facticity?] > now claim of empty/indefinite Being is a superficial way of speaking

content: “Being” is ambivalent: indefinite & definite > acc. usual logic, this is a contradiction > we are standing in the midst of this contradiction, “this standing of ours is more actual than just about anything else we call actual” (dogs, cats, automobiles, newspapers)

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: “Being” is ambivalent: indefinite & definite > acc. usual logic, this is a contradiction > we are standing in the midst of this contradiction, “this standing of ours is more actual than just about anything else we call actual” (dogs, cats, automobiles, newspapers)

content: [refutation of Nietzsche?] Being still means something definite, the most unique of all (pertains to every being), most determinate [?], can be compared to nothing else, its only other is Nothing

motif.name: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)
motif.title: CALL AND RESPONSE (WELCOME OF THE OTHER, ETHICAL OPENING)

linkedContent: [refutation of Nietzsche?] Being still means something definite, the most unique of all (pertains to every being), most determinate [?], can be compared to nothing else, its only other is Nothing

content: “to be” does present itself differently than “abracadabra” when we hear/speak/write it [is that true?] > no such thing as an empty word, only one that is worn out (vernutztes), yet remains full > “Being” retains its naming force [magically?]
linkedContent: “to be” does present itself differently than “abracadabra” when we hear/speak/write it [is that true?] > no such thing as an empty word, only one that is worn out (vernutztes), yet remains full > “Being” retains its naming force [magically?]

content: “Being” as concept most universal, highest of all: we must refer to what stands “under” it to overcome emptiness of concept [why?]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

linkedContent: “Being” as concept most universal, highest of all: we must refer to what stands “under” it to overcome emptiness of concept [why?]

content: word “Being” is a universal name, no examples of Being > rather than moving to particular, we should raise the uniqueness of this name to level of knowledge

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

linkedContent: word “Being” is a universal name, no examples of Being > rather than moving to particular, we should raise the uniqueness of this name to level of knowledge

content: that we distinguish Being from not-Being evidence that we still understand Being, that it’s not just an empty word
linkedContent: that we distinguish Being from not-Being evidence that we still understand Being, that it’s not just an empty word

content: w/out Being: no language at all, no single word [transcendental signifier]

motif.name: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
motif.title: HIEROGLYPH / PASIGRAPHY / LEIBNIZ / CHINESE / UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE

linkedContent: w/out Being: no language at all, no single word [transcendental signifier]

content: must not remain indifferent to our Dasein to know Being [proximity] > Being has highest rank [value]: power in which possibility of essence of our Dasein is grounded
linkedContent: must not remain indifferent to our Dasein to know Being [proximity] > Being has highest rank [value]: power in which possibility of essence of our Dasein is grounded

content: Being most worthy of questioning [but you think beyond value?]

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: Being most worthy of questioning [but you think beyond value?]

content: only time when there are human beings [Being needs man], time temporalizes itself  > the definiteness by which we understand indefinite meaning of Being can be delimited unambiguously [facticity of meaning of Being], rules us from ground up

motif.name: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"
motif.title: DERRIDA CONFESSES, SUMMARIZES in "Punctuations: the Time of a Thesis"

linkedContent: only time when there are human beings [Being needs man], time temporalizes itself > the definiteness by which we understand indefinite meaning of Being can be delimited unambiguously [facticity of meaning of Being], rules us from ground up

content: philosophy has no object at all, philosophy a happening (Geschehnis), must at all times work out Being for itself anew > evanescence of Being explained: 1) blurring of infinitive 2) blending of etymological roots > this is thus why history of metaphysics goes to particular beings, does not begin w/ Being in questionworthiness (Fragwürdige) [value] of its openness

linkedContent: philosophy has no object at all, philosophy a happening (Geschehnis), must at all times work out Being for itself anew > evanescence of Being explained: 1) blurring of infinitive 2) blending of etymological roots > this is thus why history of metaphysics goes to particular beings, does not begin w/ Being in questionworthiness (Fragwürdige) [value] of its openness

content: essence of Being [?] already lit itself up, but remains unquestioned > is Being evaporating into indifference? or is Being most worthy of questioning? > question of Being is not a matter of grammar & etymology [?]: language at stake in a special way

content: get beyond meanings of Being, get at that thing [phenomenology], but Being is no thing > passing through meaning of “Being,” we mean Being itself

motif.name: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY
motif.title: BEYOND ECONOMY / SURPLUS VALUE / GENERAL ECONOMY

linkedContent: get beyond meanings of Being, get at that thing [phenomenology], but Being is no thing > passing through meaning of “Being,” we mean Being itself

content: word & meaning are bound > “Being itself relies on word in a totally different and more essential sense than any being does” [transcendental signifier, value?]
linkedContent: word & meaning are bound > “Being itself relies on word in a totally different and more essential sense than any being does” [transcendental signifier, value?]

content: pay attention to Being by paying attention to how it is said: “God is,” “The earth is,” etc.

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

linkedContent: pay attention to Being by paying attention to how it is said: “God is,” “The earth is,” etc.

content: wouldn't the manifold use of “is” show that Being must be indeterminate in order to be susceptible to determination?
linkedContent: wouldn't the manifold use of “is” show that Being must be indeterminate in order to be susceptible to determination?

content: [plurivocity] definite unitary trait runs through all meanings of “Being”
linkedContent: [plurivocity] definite unitary trait runs through all meanings of “Being”

content: priority of “is” (third person singular of present indicative) > “to be” as infinitive of “is”
linkedContent: priority of “is” (third person singular of present indicative) > “to be” as infinitive of “is”

content: Being has the meaning we have indicated [?], a definiteness that has long ruled our Dasein [?]: boundary drawn around sense of“Being” stays w/in sphere of “presentness and presence (Gegenwärtigkeit und Anwesenheit), substance and substance (Bestehen und Bestand), staying and coming forth” [?] [facticity of presence?] > our understanding of “to be” drawn to this horizon, and thus fulfilled
linkedContent: Being has the meaning we have indicated [?], a definiteness that has long ruled our Dasein [?]: boundary drawn around sense of“Being” stays w/in sphere of “presentness and presence (Gegenwärtigkeit und Anwesenheit), substance and substance (Bestehen und Bestand), staying and coming forth” [?] [facticity of presence?] > our understanding of “to be” drawn to this horizon, and thus fulfilled

content: search for meaning of word “Being” becomes explicitly what it is: meditation on provenance of our concealed history
linkedContent: search for meaning of word “Being” becomes explicitly what it is: meditation on provenance of our concealed history
